title: Fairport Convention
summary: Fairport Convention are a British folk rock band, formed in 1967 by guitarists Richard Thompson and Simon Nicol, bassist Ashley Hutchings and drummer Shaun Frater (with Frater replaced by Martin Lamble after their first gig.)[2] They started out heavily influenced by American folk rock, with a setlist dominated by Bob Dylan and Joni Mitchell songs and a sound that earned them the nickname "the British Jefferson Airplane".[3] Vocalists Judy Dyble and Iain Matthews joined them before the recording of their self-titled debut in 1968;[4] afterwards, Dyble was replaced by Sandy Denny, with Matthews later leaving during the recording of their third album.[5]
